t: Proverbs 14
Every*pn wise woman builds her house, but*ln a foolish one tears it down with her own hands.
Whoever*pn lives with integrity fears the Lord,*s but*ln the one who is devious in his ways despises him.
The*pn proud speech of a fool brings a rod of discipline, but*ln the lips of the wise protect them.
Where*pn there are no oxen, the feeding trough is empty, but*ln an abundant harvest comes through the strength of an ox.
An*pn honest witness does not deceive, but*ln a dishonest witness utters lies.
A*pn mocker seeks wisdom and doesn’t find it, but*ln knowledge comes easily to the perceptive.
Stay*pn away from a foolish person; you*ln will gain no knowledge from his speech.
The*pn sensible person’s wisdom is to consider his way, but*ln the stupidity of fools deceives them.
Fools*pn mock at making reparation, but*ln there is goodwill among the upright.
The*pn heart knows its own bitterness, and*ln no outsider shares in its joy.
The*pn house of the wicked will be destroyed, but*ln the tent of the upright will flourish.
There*pn is a way that seems right to a person, but*ln its end is the way to death.
Even*pn in laughter a heart may be sad, and*ln joy may end in grief.
The*pn disloyal one will get what his conduct deserves, and*ln a good one, what his deeds deserve.
The*pn inexperienced one believes anything, but*ln the sensible one watches his steps.
A*pn wise person is cautious and turns from evil, but*ln a fool is easily angered and is careless.
A*pn quick-tempered person acts foolishly, and*ln one who schemes is hated.
The*pn inexperienced inherit foolishness, but*ln the sensible are crowned with knowledge.
The*pn evil bow before those who are good, and*ln the wicked, at the gates of the righteous.
A*pn poor person is hated even by his neighbor, but*ln there are many who love the rich.
The*pn one who despises his neighbor sins, but*ln whoever shows kindness to the poor will be happy.
Don’t*pn those who plan evil go astray? But*ln those who plan good find loyalty and faithfulness.
There*pn is profit in all hard work, but*ln endless talk leads only to poverty.
The*pn crown of the wise is their wealth, but*ln the foolishness of fools produces foolishness.
A*pn truthful witness rescues lives, but*ln one who utters lies is deceitful.
In*pn the fear of the Lord*s one has strong confidence and*ln his children have a refuge.
The*pn fear of the Lord*s is a fountain of life, turning*ln people away from the snares of death.
A*pn large population is a king’s splendor, but*ln a shortage of people is a ruler’s devastation.
A*pn patient person shows great understanding, but*ln a quick-tempered one promotes foolishness.
A*pn tranquil heart is life to the body, but*ln jealousy is rottenness to the bones.
The*pn one who oppresses the poor person insults his Maker, but*ln one who is kind to the needy honors him.
The*pn wicked one is thrown down by his own sin, but*ln the righteous one has a refuge in his death.
Wisdom*pn resides in the heart of the discerning; she*ln is known even among fools.
Righteousness*pn exalts a nation, but*ln sin is a disgrace to any people.
A*pn king favors a prudent servant, but*ln his anger falls on a disgraceful one.
